thread.title: Hong Kong tourist rescued after being pinned between bus and railing
thread.title_full: Hong Kong tourist rescued after being pinned between bus and railing | Daily Mail Online

author: Chris Kitching for MailOnline
title: Hong Kong tourist rescued after being pinned between bus and railing
text:
4
View
comments
A group of bystanders is being hailed for rescuing a tourist who became pinned between a tour bus and a metal railing on a Hong Kong street.
Photos taken by witnesses reveal the moment the dramatic incident unfolded in the popular area of Hung Hom yesterday.
Witnesses suggested the 41-year-old woman, identified as Ju Cheng, became trapped between the coach and railing after she jumped a queue or ignored traffic laws.
After hearing the woman's cries, bystanders freed her by pulling the metal railing away from her body
She was walking alongside the tour bus after it had dropped of passengers, and suddenly became pinned against the railing and was unable to free herself.
 Next That's one way to curl up with a good book! New hotel in... Middle-aged couple arrested for 'touching cabin crew... Teenage yobs arrested after shining bright green laser into... Let the invasion begin! Majorca and Tenerife named British... Bystanders rushed to her aid after hearing her cries of pain, and helped to free her by pulling the railing away from her body.
The tourist, who is from mainland China, was rushed to hospital to be treated for injuries, although her conditions remains unclear.
Investigators believe the woman might have been trying to jump a queue or was not respecting traffic laws
Police and bus authorities are investigating the incident and questioning the bus driver to find out if any charges are warranted.
Investigators believe the woman, who was wearing a bright pink dress and trainers, might have been trying to jump a queue or was not respecting traffic laws when the incident happened.
It appears she was walking in the road behind the bus just as it was reversing and got jammed into the railings.
